sub_topic: Identifying the cut vertices and bridges in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following undirected graph:

    1---2
    |\ /|
    | 3 |
    |/ \|
    4---5

Identify the cut vertices and bridges in this graph.
message_2:
A cut vertex (also known as an articulation point) is a vertex whose removal increases the number of connected components in the graph. A bridge is an edge whose removal increases the number of connected components in the graph.

In the given graph:

Cut vertices: Vertex 3 is a cut vertex. If we remove vertex 3, the graph will be split into two connected components: {1, 2} and {4, 5}.

Bridges: There are no bridges in this graph. Removing any single edge will not increase the number of connected components.
